node.title: Greg McMichael's Attorney Suggests Ahmaud Arbery's Actions Also to Blame For Death
node.alt: Defense attorney Laura Hogue said Ahmaud Arbery's actions are also to blame for his death during the closing arguments in the trial of the three men accused of killing Arbery. Pictured, Hogue speaks during the trial of the alleged killers of Ahmaud Arbery at the Glynn County Courthouse on November 18, 2021 in Brunswick, Georgia.
node.description: Defense attorney referred to Arbery as a "recurring nighttime intruder" in her closing arguments and pointed fingers at Arbery for his own death.
node.content:
["In the closing arguments of the trial of the three men accused of killing Ahmaud Arbery, Greg McMichael's defense attorney suggested that the 25-year-old Black jogger's actions were also to blame for his death.", "On Monday, Laura Hogue took direct aim at Arbery, saying that he wasn't \"an innocent victim,\" but rather a \"recurring nighttime intruder.\"", "Hogue suggested to the jury that Arbery would still be alive if he had not run away from Travis McMichael, McMichael's father Greg and William \"Roddie\" Bryan on February 23, 2020 when the three white men confronted him in the Satilla Shores neighborhood in Glynn County, Georgia.", "\"No one but Ahmaud Arbery made the decision to reach for or give the impression he was reaching for a handgun... and no one but Ahmaud Arbery made the decision not to stop when Travis' truck rolled up beside him,\" Hogue told the jurors.", "", "
Defense attorney Laura Hogue said Ahmaud Arbery's actions are also to blame for his death during the closing arguments in the trial of the three men accused of killing Arbery. Pictured, Hogue speaks during the trial of the alleged killers of Ahmaud Arbery at the Glynn County Courthouse on November 18, 2021 in Brunswick, Georgia.
", "On Monday, she painted Arbery as a teenager with a bright future who went astray in his twenties, before casting doubt as to whether he was actually on a run the day he was fatally shot by Travis McMichael.", "\"The choices [Arbery] made does not reflect the reality of what brought him to Satilla Shores in his khaki shorts, with no socks to cover his long dirty toenails,\" she said.", "Arbery's mother, Wanda Cooper-Jones, was seen shaking her head as Hogue made her final remarks for the jury.", "This is a developing story and will be updated as more information becomes available."]
